metadata.title: CVE-2022-0500 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in unrestricted eBPF usage by the BPF_BTF_LOAD, leading toa possible out-of-bounds memory write in the Linux kernelâ€™s BPF subsystemdue to the way a user loads BTF. This flaw allows a local user to crash orescalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0500` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 5.19.0-15.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 5.19.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 5.19.0-1001.3
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.19.0-1001.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1003.3
No subscription required
